name: Use of electric guns
text: §121‑34.5  Use of electric guns.  Members of the army or air national guard who have been qualified by training and are authorized by their commanders may use electric guns, as specifically provided in section 134-16(c) and (d), when assisting civil authorities in disaster relief, emergency management, or law enforcement functions; provided that "training" for the purposes of this section means a course of instruction or training in the use of any electric gun authorized pursuant to this section, that is provided or authorized by the manufacturer or is manufacturer-approved or is an electric gun training program approved by the army or air national guard, prior to deployment or issuance of electric guns and related equipment. [L 2011, c 144, §2; am L 2014, c 111, §8]
